answers.answer: If you used it after even a few minutes had passed, no.  HIV only lives a few seconds outside of the body.Aj
How many seconds or minutes can HIV lives outside of the body???Thanks.

About 8 seconds, give or take.This wouldn't be an effective way to transmit HIV anyway.  He'd have had to cut himself,  turn around, give you the razor, then you shave, and cut yourself.This isn't something I would worry about at all.Aj
Hi. I'm Ben.Can I catch HIV from using the same Diabetes-Tester with a couple of people at the same time? We used just one needle.Please answer my question.Thank you very much.

Yes, if someone has HIV.It wouldn't be as likely as if you had injected into a vein - I'm assuming its a finger stick tester - but there is a chance.You could also get hepatitis B or C from that.  Use your own equipment.Aj
Hi, I'm Ben.During this winter time, many people are sick and I'm not.Since I was not ill or sick within the past 2 years, can I assume that I'm not HIV positive.Please answer my question.Thanks.
If I use the same finger stick Diabetes-Tester with a couple of people AFTER 20 SECONDS, can I still have a chance to catch HIV from that needle?Please answer my question.Thank you very much.

Hi Ben,No, you can't assume you are HIV negative because you didn't get sick during the winter.  Only a test would tell you if you are HIV negative.Its unlikely that you would get HIV from the diabetes tester in the first place, and if you waited 20 seconds, it makes it even less likely.  You don't need to run out and test, and panic, but if you've never tested for HIV, its always a good idea to so you know for sure.I'm sure your test will be negative, based on the info you have given here.  I can't speak for your other risk factors, but based on this, the chances are really really low that you have HIV.Aj

No and No.And you've been John, Ben and now Nicky under the same user ID.   It makes no difference to me what your name is, but this makes it seem like a troll, and I hope it isn't.Aj

There is only one way to determine if a person is hiv positive. That's by being hiv tested. An conclusive hiv test can be done 12 weeks or more after an exposure. For hiv infection, symptoms mean nothing.
